events.title: Assassination of Roman Emperor Caracalla
events.description: Roman Emperor Caracalla was assassinated by a soldier during a campaign in Egypt, leading to the rise of his successor Macrinus.
events.significance: This event marked a significant power shift in the Roman Empire and demonstrated the volatility of imperial succession.

events.title: Birth of Ingrid Bergman
events.description: Renowned Swedish actress Ingrid Bergman was born, later becoming famous for her roles in classic films such as 'Casablanca' and 'Notorious'.
events.significance: Bergman became one of the most iconic actresses in Hollywood history, influencing cinema and culture globally.

events.title: Eruption of Volcán de Fuego in Guatemala
events.description: Volcán de Fuego erupted violently, causing significant damage and loss of life in surrounding areas.
events.significance: One of Central America's most active volcanoes, its eruption had major implications for disaster preparedness and response in the region.

events.title: Pope Francis visits the United States
events.description: Pope Francis made his first visit to the United States, addressing the United Nations and meeting with US President Barack Obama.
events.significance: This visit highlighted Pope Francis' global influence and efforts to address international issues such as climate change and social justice.
